required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of YVOIRE Y-Solution 360 for Hand Augmentation to Correct Volume Loss
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, No-treatment Controlled, Parallel, Evaluator-blind, Medical Device Pivotal Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of YVOIRE Y-Solution 360 Injected Into Dorsal Hand for Hand Augmentation to Correct Volume Loss

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of YVOIRE Y-Solution 360 in the treatment of dorsal hand to correct volume loss.

primary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1 grade improvement on Hand Volume Rating Scale (HVRS) as assessed by the evaluator-blinded

secondary_outcome.measure: ≥ 1 grade improvement on Hand Volume Rating Scale (HVRS) as assessed by the evaluator-blinded and the treating investigator
≥ 1 grade improvement on Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) as assessed by the treating investigator and the subject
secondary_outcome.description: 5-point scale rating global aesthetic improvement in appearance (score -1 - score 3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on Hand Volume Rating Scale (HVRS) as assessed by the evaluator-blinded and the treating investigator
Change from baseline on Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS) as assessed by the treating investigator and the subject
secondary_outcome.description: 5-point scale rating global aesthetic improvement in appearance (score -1 - score 3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety profile as assessed by incidence of adverse events

arm_group.description: No-treatment. At 12 weeks after the assessment, treatment maximum 5 ml including touch-up

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. 19 Years and older
2. Hand Volume Rating Scale (HVRS) of grade 2 or 3 with both hands
3. Participants who are willing to undergo the treatment of dorsal hand to correct volume loss
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Congenital defect, external injuries, lipodystrophy, unhealed wound, disease related-abnormalities, or tumors on the dorsal hands
2. Active inflammation or infection on the dorsal hands
3. Received anti-coagulation therapy, anti-platelet therapy, or expected to require repeated treatment within 2 weeks prior to visit 2 (randomization)
4. Had locally applied ointments (steroid, retinoid, anti-wrinkle production, tanning, or any other form of irritating product) or expected to require repeated treatment within 4 weeks prior to visit 2 (randomization)
5. Received immuno-suppressive medication including systemic glucocorticoids or expected to require repeated treatment within 8 weeks prior to visit 2 (randomization)
6. Received NSAIDs, Vitamin E, or expected to require repeated treatment within 1 week prior to visit 2 (randomization)
7. Had dermal filler injections (HA, CaHA, silicon, PAAG, PMMA etc.), Botulinum toxin therapy, adipose tissue transplantation, or esthetic surgery within 12 months prior to visit 2 (randomization)
